Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I added a neater address book for that GUI (was just displaying Python dictionary, now it is a table), you can click a contact in the address book and it prefills the "send to address" field. It also has multiple themes you can change on the fly and it will save your theme so you don't have to keep changing it on start up.

Content:
https://github.com/jl777/libnspv/pull/112/files
Fixed the bandwidth issue with this pull request. 
Should be able to make verified txns off chain tip now I think. Although I would need to implement it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not quite right still. üò¶ Still wokring on it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
@blackjok3r thanks!
i noticed you got rid of the bestknownheight field, but for the html display it is needed. i also made a NSPV_longestchain global to use, but i am not sure if i am setting it correctly. it also seems that the last_validated_header is very rarely set

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, it does seem it is better, but still not quite right.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I didnt get rid of it, it just was not updating for me, so i removed it form RPC. Np to put back

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i set the bestknownheight to just the highest reported height

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes still not right. I have a new version in testing right now

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and using the last_validated_header as the in sync version

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It seems also that some nodes that show as conencted do not respond... And never seemt o update anything...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it also seems that there is no need to get all headers from a node, if we know the latest validated header from any node, then couldnt we just request that header from another node and if it returns the same, then assume the earlier ones are ok?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes. this is how its working

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It fetches quickly until it has all the headers that link back to the last notarization.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then slows down to 1 node at a time.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, bandwidth is indeed much reduced

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, but my code is buggy still./ Hopefulyl wont take too much longer :abusedsmily:

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Sir Seven it seems that after a while some fullnodes go non-responsive. can you stress test a node to see if you can reliably reproduce this state on a small chain like ILN

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
`https://github.com/jl777/libnspv/pull/113/files` 
This is better. I find that it eventually only gets data from node 1 after while.. Other nodes are being sent requests, but do not respond. Have a few ideas, to mess with later on.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @blackjok3r it is strange that it isnt talking to more than a few nodes... before these changes, it was talking to all of them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i also see cases where bestknownheight is less than the "in sync" height, which seems a bit strange and not sure how that could happen

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: To slow it down, I had to slow it down... This means that it is no longer, polling every peer for the same block height every time.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Once it has enough headers to match back to chain tip, the last height it saw from each node that is a valid header (links back to last notarization) is saved.. Maybe we need to speed it up a little more, Although they all do eventually end up quite close. 
My bestknownheight is still gettting stuck.. 
```{
    "nodeid": 6,
    "protocolversion": 3,
    "ipaddress": "136.243.58.134",
    "port": 7770,
    "lastping": 1566811951,
    "time_started_con": 1566809171,
    "time_last_request": 1566811978,
    "services": 1879048197,
    "missbehavescore": 0,
    "bestknownheight": 1503652,
    "last_validated_header": 1503714
  }
```
This is why I commented it out earlier.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ALso I have left my KMD nSPV ndoe running a while and ti is now talking to all peers. Will do some investigation on this see what I can work out.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Seems an  intermittent  problem

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @Sir Seven feel free to consult me on stress test matter - there is ready scripts for spam

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think there needs to be some way to detect if a node has responded to a request. This will make things much easier.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Currently it must loop from notarization height  forwards to chain tip, but if a node does not respond, it must go back and fetch this header from another node. This seems to at times take many attempts.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The new logic that checks block heights are cached, helps a lot but its still doing undefined weird things.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also by slowing things down like this, it may lose some of its reorg handling.... Not too sure, need to test that.

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
@jl777c @TonyL Got it. Full node I've set for tests works fine for pretty much a week now, it might be a problem with libnspv stopping connection to the full node.
Well, just a few thoughts.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @blackjok3r maybe just have all incoming packets update a last responded timestamp, then you can check that to see how active a node is. it feels like you are pruning away most of the nodes and only talking to one. maybe a bit of randomization in node selection?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The timer is set for each node.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think I know whats going on, just have to mess with it longer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on the plus side, the bandwidth used is way down!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes maybe too much lol.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I am not actualky bannign any nodes so far, but I do want to try to make it try to find new peers, when one is not responding.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
If the lastvalidated height has not updated in a long time, I can try to force requests to that node, then if it fails to respond, drop it and try to add a new one.. 
Also may make th ban clear after some time, so it doesnt end up banning too many nodes permenantly.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Seems to me that getting a reliable set of peers will solve most of the edge case bugs.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all the active nodes were responding using the old bruteforce method

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, they are rsp[onding for me now also.... its only sometimes... maybe its something i changed not sure.. Will try to sort it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Before the way it worked, was to poll every node for the same block height at the same time...
I have changed it so each nodes counter/timer is seperate with a random delay... so it only polls one at  a time.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This is used by the libbtc code, but was disabled for ours... Maybe the 2 are not playing nicely together and I need to rethink how to do it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok. it does seem the issue is algorithmic and not networking related

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes agree

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Might have found it... Just a matter of tuning the delay now so that it does not go so fast.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
libnspv html wallet is now localizable into different languages. we just need a file in the same format at ~/libnspv/html/languages/english.json
we need at least the following languages: french, italian, chinese, chinese simplified, japanese, korean, russian and spanish.
those are the languages with seed words. however, the html can support basically any language, just need the language.json file
